propDescriptions.children: Node passed into the SVG element.
propDescriptions.color: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component. You can use the htmlColor prop to apply a color attribute to the SVG element. To learn how to add your own colors, check out Themed componentsâ€”Extend colors.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.fontSize: The fontSize applied to the icon. Defaults to 1rem, but can be configure to inherit font size.
propDescriptions.htmlColor: Applies a color attribute to the SVG element.
propDescriptions.inheritViewBox: If true, the root node will inherit the custom component's viewBox and the viewBox prop will be ignored. Useful when you want to reference a custom component and have SvgIcon pass that component's viewBox to the root node.
propDescriptions.shapeRendering: The shape-rendering attribute. The behavior of the different options is described on the MDN Web Docs. If you are having issues with blurry icons you should investigate this prop.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.titleAccess: Provides a human-readable title for the element that contains it. https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG-access/#Equivalent
propDescriptions.viewBox: Allows you to redefine what the coordinates without units mean inside an SVG element. For example, if the SVG element is 500 (width) by 200 (height), and you pass viewBox="0 0 50 20", this means that the coordinates inside the SVG will go from the top left corner (0,0) to bottom right (50,20) and each unit will be worth 10px.
